content: संधिः {@--1@} Union, junction, conbination, connection; संधये सरला सूची वक्रा छेदाय कर्तरी <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>; <ls>Me. 58.</ls> {@--2@} A compact, an agreement. {@--3@} Alliance, league, friendship, peace, treaty of peace (one of the six expedients to be used in foreign politics); कति प्रकाराः संधीनां भवंति <ls>H. 4</ls>; (the several kinds are described in <ls>H. 4. 106-125</ls>); शत्रुणा न हि संदध्यात्सुश्लिष्टेनापि संधिना <ls>H. 1. 88.</ls> {@--4@} A joint, articulation (of the body); तुरगानुधावनकंडितसंधेः <ls>Ś. 2.</ls> {@--5@} A fold (of a garment). {@--6@} A breach, hole, chasm. {@--7@} Especially a mine, chasm or opening made by thieves in a wall or underneath a building; वृक्षवाटिकापरिसरे संधिं कृत्वा प्रविष्टोऽस्मि मध्यमकं <ls>Mk. 3</ls>; <ls>Ms. 9. 276.</ls> {@--8@} Separation, division. {@--9@} Euphony, euphonic junction or coalition (in <ab>gram.</ab>). {@--10@} An interval, a pause. {@--11@} A critical juncture. {@--12@} An opportune moment. {@--13@} A period at the expiration of each {%Yuga%} or age. {@--14@} A division or joint (in a drama); (they are five, see <ls>S. D. 330-332</ls>); <ls>Ku. 7. 91.</ls> {@--15@} The vulva. {@--16@} Distillation.
